PageTitle: display mpls te hot-standby state interface
FuncDef: The display mpls te hot-standby state interface command displays information about primary and hot-standby CR-LSPs and tunnel switchover results on a specified tunnel interface or all tunnel interfaces.
CLIs: display mpls te hot-standby state interface { <interface-type> <interface-number> | <interface-name> }
Examples: <HUAWEI> display mpls te hot-standby state interface Tunnel1
Verbose information about the Tunnel1 hot-standby state
ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
To view information about primary and hot-standby CR-LSPs and the tunnel in use after a switchover, run the display mpls te hot-standby state command.
You can view the detailed reasons for the TE HotStandby switch by using the display mpls te hot-standby state interface command, including:
The primary LSP protocol is Down.The primary LSP BFD detects Down.The main LSP error is caused.Primary LSP FRR In Use.
